factual_claims.text: CNN has reached out to these companies for comment

emotional_claims.text: Evidence of sophisticated malware in the Pinduoduo app comes amid intense scrutiny of Chinese-developed apps like TikTok over concerns about data security
It’s like, super expansive,” he said
The app was able to continue running in the background and prevent itself from being uninstalled, which allowed it to boost its monthly active user rates, Hyppönen said
Toshin described Pinduoduo as “the most dangerous malware” ever found among mainstream apps

Rise to success Pinduoduo, which boasts a user base that accounts for three quarters of China’s online population and a market value three times that of eBay (EBAY), wasn’t always an online shopping behemoth
